src:
Philip Manshaus forklarte seg om motiv
Philip Manshaus redegjorde for motivet bak angrepet p√• moskeen i B√¶rum og drapet p√• s√∏steren under fengslingsm√∏tet mandag.
04 Nov 2019, 09:15 by NTB-Anders R. Christensen og Dag Kj√∏rholt



Draps- og terrorsiktede Philip Manshaus og hans forsvarer, advokat Unni Friis i Oslo tingrett mandag. üì∑ Foto: Heiko Junge / NTB scanpix Galleri



Draps- og terrorsiktede Philip Manshaus og forsvarerne Audun Beckstr√∏m og Unni Friis i Oslo tingrett mandag. üì∑ Foto: Heiko Junge / NTB scanpix Galleri


Manshaus gjorde nazihilsen da han kom inn i retten, slik han ogs√• har gjort i de tidligere fengslingsm√∏tene, f√∏r han som tidligere varslet kom med en uttalelse.
Her holdt han et flere minutter langt innlegg hvor han forklarte seg om motivet for angrepet p√• Al Noor-moskeen og drapet p√• sin stes√∏ster 10. august.
I retten mandag erkjente han forholdene han er siktet for, men erkjente ikke straffskyld.
Ber om fire nye uker
Politiet har bedt om at varetektsfengslingen forlenges med ytterligere fire uker, begrunnet med gjentakelsesfare. Denne gangen ba ikke politiet om noen restriksjoner, slik de hadde varslet p√• forh√•nd.
‚Äì Han er glad for at det ikke var noen restriksjoner denne gangen. Han gis n√• muligheten til √• ha kontakt med dem han √∏nsker, for eksempel sine n√¶rmeste. Det tenker jeg var naturlig. Det skal jo ikke v√¶re noen restriksjoner n√•r det ikke lenger er bevisforspillelsesfare, sier siktedes forsvarer, advokat Unni Fries, til NTB.
Mens de tidligere rettsm√∏tene har g√•tt for lukkede d√∏rer, var mandagens rettsm√∏te √•pent fordi politiet anser at det ikke lenger er fare for bevisforspillelse.
Saken ventes ferdig etterfors√∏ket i l√∏pet av desember.
Politisk synspunkt
Advokaten forklarte at hennes klient √∏nsket √• gi en kort redegj√∏relse for motivet for de handlingene han er siktet for.
‚Äì Det fikk han anledning til √• gj√∏re i dag. Han ga uttrykk for et politisk synspunkt og motivet for de handlingene han har beg√•tt. Han vil f√• anledning til √• forklare mer om det i en hovedforhandling senere, sa Fries til et fulltallig pressekorps.
P√• sp√∏rsm√•l om hvorfor Manshaus kom med en kort uttalelse, svarte hun at det ikke er praktisk √• avgi en veldig detaljert forklaring i fengslingsm√∏tet som varte i n√¶r 25 minutter. Hun la til at han etter hennes syn har forklart seg ganske detaljert i avh√∏r.
22-√•ringen benyttet seg igjen av muligheten til ikke √• svare p√• sp√∏rsm√•l i retten.
‚Äì Det er bedre √• avgi en grundig forklaring i en annen type forum, forklarte forsvareren.
Venter til hovedforhandlingen
Advokaten bemerket at politiet har sagt at de ikke har noen st√∏tte for at det har v√¶rt andre involverte i handlingene hennes klient er siktet for.
‚Äì Men jeg oppfattet jo i dag at han redegjorde for et synspunkt som det kanskje kan v√¶re flere som deler, slik han ser det, sa Fries.
Selv om Manshaus mandag kom med en kortere uttalelse i retten, sier advokaten at det i dag ikke er noe som tyder p√• at han kommer til √• forklare seg noe mer til politiet, slik han tidligere har gjort i to avh√∏r.
Hun legger til at han f√•r muligheten til √• forklare seg grundig i en hovedforhandling.
text:
Philip Manshaus explained his motive
Philip Manshaus outlined the motive behind the attack on the mosque in B√¶rum and the murder of his sister during the prison meeting on Monday.
04 Nov 2019, 09:15 by NTB-Anders R. Christensen and Dag Kj√∏rholt



The murder and terrorism of Philip Manshaus and his defender, lawyer Unni Friis in the Oslo District Court on Monday. üì∑ Photo: Heiko Junge / NTB scanpix Gallery



The killing and terrorism of Philip Manshaus and defenders Audun Beckstr√∏m and Unni Friis in the Oslo District Court on Monday. üì∑ Photo: Heiko Junge / NTB scanpix Gallery


Manshaus did the Nazi salute when he entered the court, as he has done in previous prison meetings, before making a statement as previously announced.
Here he made a several-minute post explaining the motive for the attack on the Al Noor Mosque and the murder of his step-sister on August 10.
In court Monday, he acknowledged the conditions he is charged with, but did not admit criminal charges.
Asking for four new weeks
The police have requested that the remand in custody be extended by another four weeks, justified by recurrence danger. This time, the police did not ask for any restrictions, as they had notified in advance.
- He is glad there were no restrictions this time. He is now given the opportunity to have contact with those he wants, such as his loved ones. I think that was natural. After all, there should be no restrictions when there is no longer a risk of proof, ‚Äùthe defendant's defense attorney, Unni Fries, told NTB.
While the previous hearings have gone to closed doors, Monday's hearing was open because police believe there is no longer any danger of forfeiture.
The case is expected to be completed in December.
Political point of view
The lawyer explained that her client wanted to give a brief account of the motive for the actions he was charged with.
- He had the opportunity to do that today. He expressed a political point of view and the motive for the actions he committed. He will have the opportunity to explain more about that in a main debate later, Fries told a full-fledged press corps.
When asked why Manshaus made a brief statement, she replied that it is not practical to give a very detailed explanation at the prison meeting that lasted for nearly 25 minutes. She added that, in her view, he explained quite in detail in interrogation.
The 22-year-old again took advantage of the opportunity not to answer questions in court.
- It is better to give a thorough explanation in another type of forum, the defender explained.
Waiting for the main hearing
The lawyer noted that the police have said they have no support that there have been others involved in the actions her client is charged with.
"But I understood today that he was stating a view that there may be more people sharing, as he sees it," Fries said.
Although Manshaus made a shorter statement in court on Monday, the lawyer says there is no indication today that he is going to explain anything more to the police, as he previously did in two interrogations.
She adds that he gets the opportunity to explain himself thoroughly in a main debate.
